alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 1:39AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Wayne and McCreary Counties through 215 AM EDT... At 139 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Rockeybranch, or 9 miles southeast of Monticello, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Slavens around 145 AM EDT. Ritner, Denney and Co-Operative around 150 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Marshes Siding, Stearns, Whitley City, Wiborg, Parkers Lake, Greenwood, Beulah Heights and Honeybee. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
